scenario_text.value: Taku...ma...
Looks like...we win... Aoi...
Huh...? That’s... That’s so strange...
Did I...mess up...again? Was I...wrong?
Yeah... Do you see that now?

That’s...weird. I wasn’t...supposed to...
make any more...mistakes...

There’s no such thing as someone who never
makes mistakes! I mean, look at me...

I messed up so many times, but you were all
there to tell me when I was wrong.

That’s what...I wanted to do for you. Before
it came to this.

I only... I only wanted you...to know...how
I felt...
But that...made me...a burden...

Hey, you were the one who supported us more
than anyone!

We would’ve happily supported you right back!
You never had to worry about being a burden!

Aoi...please... I want...to eat your cooking
again...

I want to stay up late...and chat until we
fall asleep... So please... You can’t...

There was...so much...I wanted...to do for
you... But it looks like...I can’t...
Aoi... Aoi!!!
I’m sorry...Labramon...
I’m so sorry, Saki...
Aoi! No...
She’s gone...
(That’s it then. It’s really over.)

(The door that Aoi opened back to our world
isn’t closing. We can...go back.)
(We can all finally go home. Only...)
(...why do I feel so bad?)
Damn it! Why did it have to end like this?!
Aoi... *sniff*... *whimper*... *sob*

When it came right down to it, we failed to
save my sister, and we failed to save Aoi.

Was... Was Aoi really so wrong? Was there
nothing else we could’ve done?!
Takuma! Takuma!!!
What is it, Agumon?

Look at the door! It’s opening wider and
wider!

You’re right... The door that Aoi opened
is...getting bigger?

Hey, what’s going on? Shouldn’t that thing
vanish now that Aoi’s gone?!

What’s going to happen if it keeps going like
that?
I don’t know...
Most likely, the worlds will merge together.

Wait, what?! You mean our world is going to
change too?!
That’s what that would mean.

Will things go back to the way they were
originally, like Aoi said?

Yes, in a way. But it shouldn’t be like this.
This forceful merger is sure to cause chaos.
What will become of us?

I can only speculate, but you Kemonogami will
likely be able to travel freely to our world.
You mean...I’ll be able to stay with Miu?!

Wait... If creatures like us start showing up
in the human world, won’t that be bad?!

Many will doubtless be overwhelmed by power,
much like Aoi was.

You mean, some humans will use creatures like
us to do bad things...

(Right... If lots of people start meeting
monsters like how I met Agumon...)

(Things aren’t always going to work out for
the best.)

(Some people might even reject their partners
despite being lucky enough to meet them.)

(Others may be afraid of their partners, or
want to manipulate them. You never know.)
Then we need to go back to our world.

We need to help everyone we can who might
suffer because of that chaos.

And we need to try and think of a way to save
both worlds.

We owe that to Aoi and Miyuki, and all the
monsters who’ve lived in this world.

More than anything, we owe it to our friends
and families waiting back home. To our world.

Man, just when I thought we were done with
all this crap...

I hear you, but this is something only we can
do.
Yeah, you’re right. I’ll have to help too.

Right. Agumon, will you and the others help
lend a hand?
You bet we will!
Of course.
After all, we’re partners. Right, Kaito?!
I couldn’t leave you on your own, Miu.
Thank you! All right, all together, then...
Just a moment! I...
I think I will remain here in this world.
Professor...
But why?!
As you know, I was unable to save my sister.
Much less Renamon, or my own partner...

Because of that, and as a form of mourning,
I want to live here. As Miyuki did.

I should also like to track down what traces
of my sister remain in this world.
Are you sure about that?

That door isn’t closing, even with my sister
gone. Sooner or later our worlds will merge.

So you needn’t worry about me. Instead, allow
me to send you off with a smile.

Takuma, that door is getting bigger as we
speak.
Yes. Go on, now.
All right...

(I have to wonder... Is this the way our
adventure was really supposed to end?)

(I feel like things could’ve been different.
But it’s no use regretting that now.)

Finally, we’re going home. I wonder what it
will be like when we get there.
We’ll just have to find out!

And then we’ll need to think of what we can
do to fix things, together with our partners.

Sounds like there’s still a lot of work to
do.

Yeah, I’m sure we’ve still got plenty of
things ahead of us...

That’s okay! I’m gonna give this everything
I got. Just like you, Takuma!
Thanks, Agumon.
All right, everybody hold hands...
...and let’s go!
